content: crochet granny squares are the most versatile projects to make there are just so many varieties and possibilities to use the granny squares the most poplar choice of many crocheters is to make a crocheted blanket you can make up a bunch of granny squares and in the end join them up to make a pretty crochet blanket they are also great for making crochet pillows placemats tablemats and clothing accessories there are many ways to crochet a granny square today am sharing the pattern for making a seamless solid crochet circle to granny square the pattern is quite simple made with the basic crochet stitches this pattern is fun to make and works up quickly too these granny squares can be made in any size of your choice just keep adding the repeat stitches to the square and you can make them as large as you want materials used - 8 ply yarn 4 mm crochet hook size - 5 inches - customizable to any size notes - for this whole pattern the starting chain 2 is not counted as a stitch it is just to bring the yarn to a working height start the next stitch in the same stitch checkout the video tutorial here https //youtu be/yu8s6tr8ib4
